website_summaries.verdict: By far the most popular Oboz hiking boot, this durable pair will aid you through your hikes in comfort and style.
pros: Customers rave over the pair's fantastic fit, especially for those with wide feet
Boots stay warm and comfortable in all weather conditions
Available in both men's and women's styles
cons: Rubber toe covering has a tendency to crack

customer_reviews.title: Great for My Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes the second I put them on. I have wide Fred Flintstone feet, high instep, big ankles and plantar facsiatus, and have had a heck of a time finding shoes that would work for me. I walk in gravel all day at work and these shoes stabilize my foot. And the toe box is wide so my toes aren't being smooshed. I am in shoe love.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cellito

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking boots but havent been really field tested yet.
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots. Amazon lists that you can get size EE or WW, but do not believe them. I called Oboz and they informed me their biggest width is E or W ( no double wides) I also ordered the boots twice and both times i received singe wide boots. This was what lead me to call the manufacturer. The single wide width seems to be about the same width as most Merrell boots I've owned. They look and feel nice, but the pair i kept are not broken in yet and have not seen any real challenge. They seem more firm than Merrells and the mid-high ankle supports on the Oboz are a little higher than my Merrell Moab Rovers.
customer_reviews.author: Z.K.

customer_reviews.title: The wide fits like a D
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the boots. With that being said, I ordered wide based upon my other Oboz purchases. Normally I wear a 10 D or a 10 wide. With this brand I have to order the wide, or in the case of the Bridgers, I have to order a whole size up. Well made, stitching is good, and after a few days of walking they are awesome. Felt like inflexible bricks to begin with, but loosened up over time. Quickly becoming my favorite casual wear boot. Now if only they offered the black version in wide sizes...
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Initial Review 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Years of looking for the perfect boot, and this pair delivered. Lightweight, sturdy, good ankle support, excellent feel to the sole as it has a particular roll that springs the step forward. My heel is firmly seated in the cup at the rear and the width of the boot is perfect for my slightly wide foot. I'd never heard of Oboz and after my favorite boot morphed over the years to fit a narrow foot, this boot is perfect. I'm only a month into owning them with some good miles, but initial review is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: A. Grabiec

customer_reviews.title: Oboz hit the mark with these boots
customer_reviews.text: Just back from an AT 5 night hike with friends. Boots were easily broken in while working on Florida trails and parks. They are very comfortable with good protection and support on the rocky trails of N. Carolina. Ran into a couple days of rain and true to their name, the boots stayed dry. My only complaint is they seemed to slip very easily on damp rock and roots. I had to be extra careful in those situations. Not sure if this is unique to the shoe or a common criticism with any boot. I would recommend these boots as long as they fit you well.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Hims

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of Oboz, and my first pair are my favorite shoe/boot ever! Of course, my first pair is a discontinued model, but this one is very similar, and seems to live up to the quality and comfort i expect from these puppies. I am basically a 9-91/2 in most shoes, but I am a definite 10 in these, so I do advise go a 1/2 size up with Oboz. Once you hike a bit in this brand of boot, you will be a believer, I am pretty certain. I am a finicky bastard when it comes to footwear, and I am now a life-long Oboz-er. Worth every cent, so do not hesitate investing in your feet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Can hardly wait to get out on the trail with these!
customer_reviews.text: This is now my third pair of Oboz since I was first introduced to the brand two years ago by an excellent sales associate at an REI in Santa Fe, NM. This purchased, however, is my first mid boot and they feel great straight out of the box. I thought they might require some break in at first but am delight that this is not the case at all. I bought these to provide better ankle support on moderate to difficult trails with just a hydration pack in tow.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Weird/small toe box..just not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these boots..I even sent the regular back for a wide, but it’s the toe box that kept killing my little toe (and knuckle). The width seemed fine, but for reason the boots pushed against the top of my little toe knuckle and became very painful. My feet are 10.5..so nothing crazy either. Otherwise the boots looked and felt great. I’m sure they would have lasted a long time!
customer_reviews.author: wegentryjr

customer_reviews.title: My Feet Are In Heaven!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable and best-fitting hiking boots I have been able to find. And I have tried at least 15 brands! I have wide feet and ordered a Wide and the toe box is really roomy. Many other brands I tried cramped my toes even in a Wide size, especially the European brands. I would highly recommend ordering 1/2 size larger than you normally wear. The do run a little small in the length. The workmanship and quality is excellent. These are my new favorite brand. Thank you Oboz!
customer_reviews.author: B boy

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of these boots because I wear them all the time. I'm in my 50s with arthritis and multiple ACL knee surgeries and until I found these boots I was unable to be on my feet all day. Now I can do construction work or spend the day in the woods without constant foot or joint pain. The boots are very durable and hold up well. Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Dcrab

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I just received the boots but already love them. I am a SRO and walk all day plus I am over weight. These boots are top quality and built to last. The comfort is over the top. Get out of those cheap ass duty boots. The extra money is worth it. Good luck LEOs.
customer_reviews.author: Paratus

customer_reviews.title: Well-Built, durable hiker
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these at the same time as a couple different low-top hiking shoes, and these won me over. I ordered them in wide, and that was a critical difference for my fit. After being very disappointed in my last pair of Keen hiking shoes, I was looking for something that would hold up. The Oboz boot proved itself on a week-long hiking vacation around Cody, WY. The sole was very durable - this was my greatest concern - and and I'm very pleased at how it has worn (or not worn, to be specific).
customer_reviews.author: C Eric

customer_reviews.title: Best field-slippers!
customer_reviews.text: I am a field ecologist and have worn through many boots. These are my favorite to date (burning through boots since 2006), but by no means would I categorize them as “serious”. If you want a boot that will last >1.5 years of heavy use, get something else — with a full leather upper (few pieces as possible) and a Vibram sole. If you want a boot that’s enjoyable to walk in rough terrain, all day, every day, for ~1.5 years, get yourself some Oboz Bridgers! Old busted boot and current boot (after 3 months of heavy daily use) shown in separate photographs. Hoping that regular cleaning & treating/waterproofing will help the new pair last longer than my first!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Caird

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These boots have seen the top of 12 peaks over 4,000 ft. Short initial break in, but not a sign of wear to date. I wouldnt want any other boot on my feet while on trail period. Secure, waterproof, and knobby tread that grabs the ground under you.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: OBOZ Excellent footwear 👍
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived new and in original box as described perfect fit. Would by from this Tahoe Mountain Sports again But might request USPS for delivery so I get it Ups delivered to my neighbor Dont know why the two addresses completely different Thank you
customer_reviews.author: RAL

customer_reviews.title: Oboz hit a home-run with this one.
customer_reviews.text: Since owning these shoes in April. I consistently wear these boots throughout the week. The all black look of the shoe and its comfort make me feel so good and almost never make my feet uncomfortable. Obviously it will get uncomfortable if you are standing all day and don't take a break, these shoes are always my constant go to when I'm going outside. They are completely waterproof and keep my feet warm. Wearing some thinner socks fixes the heat problem and the shoes are bearable even during the summer. Thanks Oboz for coming out with a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Jacky B

customer_reviews.title: Oboz boots worthy replacements for my Keens.
customer_reviews.text: These fit as suggested more than as expected. Amazon had a fit questionnaire that suggested this size for me, they fit perfectly. If I would have ordered my usual size they would have been a bit small. These are my first pair of Oboz boots, and so far they have been great. They look great, are waterproof, and fit well (after ordering a half size up). I have been wearing Keens for the last few years and so far these have been comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Teton Jackson

customer_reviews.title: perfect for anyone on their feet all day!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots I run an auto parts store and walk anywhere from 6 to 12 miles a day on concrete floors. My feet don't hurt after long days and I still want to put them on for my days off to wear around the house or on the trails. Fits perfectly to size. I would recommend giving them a few days of breaking in before taking them out on the trails. Love these boots will buy more on the future
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Loosing grips on wet hard surfaces
customer_reviews.text: So far, most of the features are very good, except wet hard surfaces, you would loose grips, pay extra attention before walking into areas like river bank with rocks or rocky surface in foggy/rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon & Ling

customer_reviews.title: because I need a narrow heel and a genrous toe box I've had trouble finding boots that fit comfortably. These are my favorite
customer_reviews.text: Historically, because I need a narrow heel and a genrous toe box I've had trouble finding boots that fit comfortably. These are my favorite. I had worn them for days on end while hiking in the Northeastern US., South America and Spain. They have always treated my feet well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hiking boots I have ever owned. This is my second pair of boots and only replaced because I wiped out the soles after years of every day usage. Zero break in time. Traction and water proof along with good looks.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: We hike ADK and I love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these at REI and ordered a second pair on Amazon. They fit perfect and I can hike a high peak right after taking them out of the box. I treat them with water repellent and they keep my feet warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: kc2pxp

customer_reviews.title: This boot fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: This boot fits like a glove. It is just what I wanted for summer hiking. It is light weight and no break in needed. I wear the thinnest socks I can with these which is what I was hoping for. If I was going to wear thick socks I would have to go a 1/2 size larger but this is exactly what I wanted for summer so I ordered my usual size and don't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible wet traction
customer_reviews.text: The worst wet condition shoes/boots I have ever owned. Why are they waterproof if they don't grip when its wet?
customer_reviews.author: Jim Moore

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow boot
customer_reviews.text: I have narrow, flat feet. I had to go up a half size and get wide width. Boots were still pretty snug. My feet sweated in these boots while wearing them during non strenuous activities. I returned them. I really like the Teva Arrowood
customer_reviews.author: Shovel

customer_reviews.title: Room to wiggle my foot...
customer_reviews.text: The wides are awesome. Barely wider than the regular, but room for my forefoot to spread out some. Heel does not slip. These work very well for my feet. Construction is solid, and so far waterproof in soaked pastures. No creeks or standing water though.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Give them a try
customer_reviews.text: This boot for some reason ran small. A full size and a half to small. My husband got them in a size 12 which he wears and fit him just fine. So I don’t know what happen with mine. But they are the most comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband adores these boots and that's saying a lot since we can never find a pair of shoes in a store that fit him ... 13- 4E with cushioning to ease the pain of corns and calluses, a wide toe box to stay away from ingrown toenails, and excellent arch support for someone who is on ladders much of the time at work, but still flexible enough to allow him to crouch and kneel, and lightweight enough to not add extra fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorsy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness there is still a quality shoe manufacturer out there producing a variety of widths (most importantly wide and extra wide for me). Comfy fit for those with a wide foot. New Balance I wear a 12 EE or 12 EEEE, same with Timberland, and the 12 EE from Oboz is a perfect fit for me. No clunky gap in the toe box that makes the shoe too long like some Timberland.
customer_reviews.author: B from SLO

customer_reviews.title: Decent fit - true to size
customer_reviews.text: I took a gamble based on other reviews and ordered a half size larger. I probably would have been fine with my normal size, but they are still usable. They are not narrow at all for my standard width foot and the toe box is roomy. The downside is the high price and the fact that the soles are very hard. I was hoping for a slightly more comfortable sole.
customer_reviews.author: John Mangan

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: These are my 3rd pair of Oboz. Have the slip ons and the tennis shoes. These hiking boots are the best I’ve ever had and I’m 65 years old. OBOZ FOREVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: No break in required. Very comfortable from the moment I put them on. I wear a 10 1/2 W in LL Bean hiking boots. I tried an 11 W with the Oboz, and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Green MT Man

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing boot. Extremely comfortable and very snug fit
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing boot. Extremely comfortable and very snug fit. The boot just feels like it was put together with care to quality. Have had these for about 6 months wearing out on camping trips and love them.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of these boots. Love them!! I use them as my everyday/work boot and they are very comfortable. There is little to no break in required and they are comfortable right out of the box. My first pair lasted approximately two years wearing them almost everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan F. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Had them about a month. Loved them at first sight and my love has only grown deeper the more I wear them! I like them so much I my wife also got a pair of Oboz... and she loves hers too!
customer_reviews.author: jon ruffo

customer_reviews.title: A bit small
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get to put these boots to the test, they were too small. (stayed indoors on clean floors to keep them pristine) They did appear to be of excellent construction and they have a very nice stock insole. Unfortunately I can't recommend a size adjustment. The 11.5 W was a bit too narrow and low in volume, but the arch was in the proper place.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: but the laces are a bit shorter which is great so now I don't have to double tie to ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a replacement pair after wearing the last for 2 years. Still the same as the pair I bought then, but the laces are a bit shorter which is great so now I don't have to double tie to keep them out of the mud. I wear these daily Sept-May, I would recommend a gel insole.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality
customer_reviews.text: Best comfort hiking work riding boot out there. Was once a keen shoe person but now I wear oboz. The quality is so much better and more comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Adios Merrell!
customer_reviews.text: If you’re needing a great looking boot that’s well designed and constructed. Comfortable right out of the box and worth the price. Then you should purchase some of these boots. The only reason I didn’t give them 5 stars is because I haven’t had them long enough to see how they wear over time. I especially like the aggressive sole. I’m pretty sure this won’t be the only pair I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Gato/Montes

customer_reviews.title: I will buy these again when these wear out
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and have to be careful with shoe selection. Let me tell you these boots rock. The factory insoles are awesome. The boot provides great support. Can carry heavy pack for long treks without a problem. I would say they were not 100% waterproof out of the box. I treated the leather and have been bone dry since.
customer_reviews.author: JONATHAN A BOWSER

customer_reviews.title: Great boots right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I got them, tried them on, they fit great. The next day I put them on & hiked for 7.8 miles through very rough mountainous terrain. I couldn't believe it, but at the end of the day I had no blisters or sore spots. What boots don't need to be broken in?! Great boots!
customer_reviews.author: bijou

customer_reviews.title: Oboz Hdqtrs Responds
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon vendor did not respond to me. I contacted Oboz Hdqtrs and they advised me that Mid and product ordered are one and the same.
customer_reviews.author: marcus

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Great fit and great look. They fit snug around the ankle, the way a hiking boot should, and have great arch support as well. Look great with jeans and khakis.
customer_reviews.author: K. Greer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, well made, protective
customer_reviews.text: Wore them to work, and play hiking through Texas hill country. Hold up nicely, totally waterproof even when submerged to the top of the foot, and the toe guard is solid. Like these boots a lot, really comfortable right out of the box and well made. Had to jog out of the Barton Creek green belt to avoid being caught in the woods in the dark and found them as comfortable as any trail runner i've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of shoes I've ever owned. This is my second pair. The first pair had close to 100 mountain hiking miles on them - plus they were my every day boot. Wore them to work, on horseback, backpacking, etc. . . Keep it up Oboz
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Easiest break-in of any boots I have worn. Durability is unknown. So far they are fine for all day wear.
customer_reviews.author: Desantnik

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots!
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my husband and he LOVES them! Has gone on many hikes and says they are the best for comfort and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: jessica blikre

customer_reviews.title: Wide version not wide at all.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had to return this boots. I got 10W, but Oboz version of wide was quite narrow. Higher arch than anticipated. Great it what I described fits your feet. They seem really well made, just would not accommodate my wide, flat feet.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Light, tough, good support when loaded up.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased four pairs of these for myself and even more for my children. I have also purchased other Oboz models but these are my favorite. Whether at 190 slick, or 240 kitted up I choose Oboz. If it works in Montana it will work anywhere! Thank you Oboz!
customer_reviews.author: Ugly Driver

customer_reviews.title: comfortable with little break in needed.
customer_reviews.text: Great boot for the rocks of the AT. Thru hiking the AT this year and put on the Bridgers in PA. Foot pain went away and no blisters. I have 700 miles on them and they are still holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run small and natrow
customer_reviews.text: Size 10M were too small toes right to tip abs width too tight. Love true boot so ordered 10.5 W and they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jean M. Hurley

customer_reviews.title: theback is stiff but should flex better with time
customer_reviews.text: the shoe, even though its listed as ee , is narrow. theback is stiff but should flex better with time. I like the foot bed; especially the arch. I'm 76 years old and very cranky about shoes. This pair is ok.
customer_reviews.author: ike

customer_reviews.title: First the Firebrands, now the Bridgers...I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I've been pleased with Oboz shoes in general going back to the original Firebrands from about 6 years ago. I have size 12 EE feet and these Bridgers in wide fit very comfortably. Not only that but to start the breaking in process with a 6 mile rugged terrain hike only reinforced my enthusiasm for the boots.
customer_reviews.author: The H-Man

customer_reviews.title: Width and sock weight
customer_reviews.text: Have marginally wide feet, 4” at the widest point, size 10. The wide fits perfectly with thinner socks on, right out of the box. After break in, slightly heavier socks are perfect. Like the thorlo medium weight boot sock. But the thin socks still feel great! No matter when.
customer_reviews.author: charlie frayer

customer_reviews.title: Oboz
customer_reviews.text: Love my Oboz. They fit great. I normally wear a 10 but I decided to go for a 10.5. Glad I did...
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Runs small...
customer_reviews.text: A very well made boot. Beware...the boot runs small and slightly narrow. Have always worn size 12 Med (Vasque, Salmon, Keen and Scarpa). But had to send back because of sizing. Not sure if I will try a 13.
customer_reviews.author: John Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Best trail shoes I've owned in 45 years of mountain climbing.
customer_reviews.text: Best trail shoes I've owned in 45 years of mountain climbing.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: A great light boot.
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair. I climbed over 185 mountains wearing my third pair. Good water proofing. I will buy a fifth pair after my next 185 summits.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Took some time to wear in but it's a great boot. Nice deep lugs and a supportive somewhat ...
customer_reviews.text: Took some time to wear in but it's a great boot. Nice deep lugs and a supportive somewhat rigid sole. I like that the heal is rolled vs sticking out like others. This makes it easier to move quickly especially if your doing deliberate heal to toe movements.
customer_reviews.author: taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and great looking boot, very happy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice hiking boot, I have yet to take them out in the mountains but a healthy amount of in-town travels have proven them worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I like that there is know break in period..Your foot slides in smooth and slides out smooth when you take them off..I would definitely buy another pair of Oboz's.. Highly recommend this boots if you're looking for comfort and that rugged durable style of boot.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Greaves

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot So Far
customer_reviews.text: I have not had the chance to put them to the test but the break in period has been very easy, I will be doing some hikes soon and am taking them on a six week trek through India. Will let you know how they feel in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: David Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. The shoe feels very solid
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. The shoe feels very solid, and provides good support. Compared to Keens, this is like a truck compared to an economy car in toughness. The sole is very grippy, and the lacing hardware is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Ian G. Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: When everything else is wet, your feet will be dry!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit of these shoes. I walk all day for work and they are perfect. When it rains outside my feet always stay dry. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe with great support and protection
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Just wide enough in the toe box that it doesn't crush my third and fourth toes like a lot of the others i have tried. Spent the last two weekends knee deep in dirt landscaping my yard and these kept my feet in fine shape. Great arch support too.
customer_reviews.author: sdhotelier

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boot, but not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot, great in moderate cold. Waterproof? Not at all. It’s definitely water resistant but unlike its description it can barely handle a puddle, let alone snow. Definitely regret buying these
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable. Great arch support. It's a cross between merrel & keen.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Very good boots! Foot bed is firm and can take ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good boots! Foot bed is firm and can take a little time to get used to. Good arch support. Only minus, is the sole wore out faster than expected, but I do a lot of walking.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow, even the wide size
customer_reviews.text: First pair I ordered in my usual size was way too narrow. So I sent it back and got the "wide" size. Still too narrow. I don't know if Oboz typically run narrow, since this is my first purchase of them, but this style definitely was too narrow for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin J Mings

customer_reviews.title: Good looking boot
customer_reviews.text: Fit well but need broke in. Break in seems longer than my keens did. May be that I am getting older, but I do hike a lot.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Great fit out of the box use them for farming and everything
customer_reviews.author: Chase Kosa

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best footwear I've ever had in my life
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best footwear I've ever had in my life. Brought these down to South America for Peace Corps service and they were worth every penny. Comfortable, awesomely waterproof, easy to clean, great traction, and pretty cool looking as well. Eat your heart out Merrell, Vasque, and all the others.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer B

customer_reviews.title: My wide foot appreciates Oboz. Dry and Comfortable always.
customer_reviews.text: I had another pair in another style. The size was perfectly consistent and the quality is excellent as expected for this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Westman

customer_reviews.title: ... only worn these once on the treadmill to ensure good fit and once on a trail workday for 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn these once on the treadmill to ensure good fit and once on a trail workday for 4 hours. For starters I normally wear a 9.5-10 in most shoes but tried these on at a local store first. For me a size 9 fit perfect so that's what I ordered and they feel great (using very thin cycling/hiking socks). Doing a 12 mile hike in Colorado soon and looking forward to wearing these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really water Proof
customer_reviews.text: Buy one size bigger they run small. I wear 11 and bought 12.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Hill

customer_reviews.title: Warm and definitely waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and just a little stiff. Vertical toe room is a little lacking, maybe a problem with thicker socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hike like a superhero.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible! Super comfortable with superhero-like ability to stick to the ground. Hiked over muddy rocks without slipping. Wore them for my hike up the blue ridge. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Wore these when I attended a three day Survial class, it rained the entire time. Never had to change my socks (which is nasty ) VERY waterproof
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have literally gone thru 4 pairs of these....Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for work on a daily basis. They are waterproof and very comfortable to traverse any terrain. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Comfort & Fit
customer_reviews.text: Rated the top hiking boot by the Boy Scouts; it more comfortable than most other hiking boots I have owned. Thus far, found to be warm, waterproof and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Harder

customer_reviews.title: They’re great!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are terrific. Just ordered my second pair. The last pair lasted me 2+ years on a job site. Super comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Connor

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: They run a little small. Once I went up a half size, the fit perfectly and they really keep my feet dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad after such a long use
customer_reviews.text: I have had a previous pair for 7 years without complaint. Finally, leather started to wear out on sides where foot flexes. Not bad after such a long use! Best walking/hiking shoes in terms of comfort and water impermeability.
customer_reviews.author: Anis Racy

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, unfortunately sole is delaminating from upper. Unacceptable for a shoe of this price and "quality". Unlikely I will buy another from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: JoshF

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love Oboz. Super rugged shoe. My new go to brand for the A.T.
customer_reviews.author: Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit very well, maybe just a tiny bit larger than other brands of the same size. With very little break in for them, they've been taken on a couple of five mile hikes. No blisters - only minor discomfort around the top of the boots while they were broken in. My next set of boots will be a set of Oboz.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this shoe almost every day for a year. I wear them to work, to hike, to hunt and fish. This boot is my favorite shoe of all time and I plan to save up and buy several pairs. You'll really like this boot.
customer_reviews.author: Strong Bad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boot.
customer_reviews.text: Great product I have a few different styles of boots from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Matt87

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great boot, work as greenskeeper and they have lasted the longest of any boot I have owned>
customer_reviews.author: KjO

customer_reviews.title: Rest in Place
customer_reviews.text: The best boots I have had in a long time. I run a lot of miles in light shoes (mostly) and then I go to work, where I am on my feet in a warehouse environment, and my feet are very comfy in these boots, glad I found them.
customer_reviews.author: LEM 617

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe like how easy the mud and dirt cleans out of tread
customer_reviews.author: chris dean larson

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair of Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for the perfect hiking boots and these fit the bill! I've been wearing them for several weeks now and I have nothing but good things to say.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Fig Newton

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Oboz boots!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of boots by Oboz. I've had 4 or 5 pairs of their shoes and was always impressed by the quality, fit and toughness of their products. So far the boots are falling right in line.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Richardson

customer_reviews.title: It says I MUST enter a headline
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots, almost zero break in time. Run small; 11.5 wide fits like 10.5 regular Wolverine boots.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: Great fit! Took a couple days of light walking to break-in. Very comfortable. Rugged and waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. They're dry, comfortable, and good quality boots.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Look No Further..
customer_reviews.text: I have worked Law Enforcement for the past 8 years and have been constantly searching for a comfortable, durable boot that lasts longer than a year. After trying Danner, 5.11, Bates, etc, I was still not content until I bought these. These boots are comfortable all day and keep my feet warm and dry when out in weather, which it sees a lot here in Wyoming. They are very lightweight and my knees don't hurt after wearing them all day. The durability is great and after 8 months, they are showing no signs of slowing down. I will be buying another pair in the near future for hunting and would highly recommend these boots to anyone. They will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Jmfedd

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable boot
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable boot! Solidly built, however, I have not been able to put it through the gamut. This is my first high end hiking boot and so far these rock. I'm not new to high end boots, just hiking boots. I definitely recommend considering these boots.
customer_reviews.author: dustin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots with great support
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots with great support, my only gripe is the need a heel loop to help putting them on. I had a foot/ankle injury and needed support, these are great out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Fortunato

customer_reviews.title: too short
customer_reviews.text: nice shoe but too small for me---must need 15s in this boot
customer_reviews.author: larry broder

product_meta.title: Oboz Men's Bridger BDRY Hiking boot
